metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:process58_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:process58_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the process58_object is supported with the name entity equal to some value and the pid entity greater than some value.
Test that the process58_object is supported with the name entity not equal to some value and the pid entity greater than or equal to some value.
Test that the process58_object is supported with the name entity matching some regular expression and a pid greater than some value.
Test that the process58_object is supported with the pid entity less than some value.
Test that the process58_object is supported with the pid entity less than or equal to some value.

process58_test.comment: Test that the process58_object is supported with the name entity equal to some value and the pid entity greater than some value.
Test that the process58_object is supported with the name entity not equal to some value and the pid entity greater than or equal to some value.
Test that the process58_object is supported with the name entity matching some regular expression.
Test that the process58_object is supported with the pid entity less than some value.
Test that the process58_object is supported with the pid entity less than or equal to some value.

process58_object.comment: Retrieve an process58_item with a name equal to 'winlogon.exe' and a pid greater than '0'.
Retrieve process58_items with names that are not equal to 'winlogon.exe' and a pid greater than or equal to '0'.
Retrieve process58_items with names that match the regular expression '^winl[o,g]{2}on\.exe$' and a pid greater than '0'.
Retrieve process58_items with a pid less than 1000.
Retrieve process58_items with pid less than or equal to 1000.

process58_state.comment: This state represents an process58_item that has a name equal to 'winlogon.exe'.
This state represents process58_items that have a name not equal to 'winlogon.exe'.
This state represents process58_items that have a name that matches the regular expression '^winl[o,g]{2}on\.exe$'.
This state represents process58_items where the pid is less than '1000'.
This state represents process58_items where the pid is less than or equal to '1000'.
